thread.title: Lahiri finishes tied seventh at Hong Kong Open
thread.title_full: Lahiri finishes tied seventh at Hong Kong Open

author: tribuneindia.com
title: Lahiri finishes tied seventh at Hong Kong Open
text:
Hong Kong
Anirban Lahiri failed to muster a final day challenge due to fatigue and could post only one-over 71 to finish tied seventh, while compatriots Gaganjeet Bhullar and Rahill Gangjee grabbed the tied 13th and joint 18th place, respectively, in the UBS Hong Kong Open. Coming into the fourth round, Asian Tour leader Lahiri traded three bogeys (first, 16th and 18th) two birdies (third and sixth) for a 71 at the Hong Kong Golf Club. It pushed his total to 10-under 270 (67-67-65-71) — seven shots behind winner Justin Rose of England (68), who registered a single stroke victory over Denmark's Lucas Bjerregaard. "I just felt like I ran out of gas today and didn't have much energy left in the tank. I'm obviously disappointed with how I finished," said Lahiri. Guwahati
South Asian Games to held from Feb 6-16 The South Asian Games will be held in Guwahati and Shillong from February 6 to 16 next year with eight countries, including hosts India, participating in the event. "There would be 25 disciplines, with 17 of them scheduled to be held in Guwahati and eight in Shillong," said Assam Chief Minister Tarun Gogoi here today. The participating countries are Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Bhutan, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka and hosts India. Nearly 4,000 athletes and officials are expected to take part in various sports disciplines. Gurgaon
Aditi best Indian at tied 13th, Emily wins Indian Open golf Amateur golfer Aditi Ashok scored a five-over 77 to finish tied 13th, while Denmark's Emily Kristine Pedersen won the title following a 73 in the Hero Women's Indian Open at the DLF Golf and Country Club here on Sunday. Aditi struggled with three birdies, four bogeys and two double-bogeys for a 77 that took her total to nine-over 225. She was nine strokes behind Emily, who fended off a strong challenge from Cheyenne Woods (one-under 71), Becky Morgan (73) and Malene Jorgensen (72) to win the title. Pune
Yuki gets an easy draw Top seed Yuki Bhambri has got an easy opener as he has been pitted against local wild card Anvit Bendre in the ATP KPTI challenger event, beginning here on Monday. In-form sixth seed Saketh Myneni faces Ilya Ivashka, while Sanam Singh will lock horns with Alessandro Bega. Somdev Devvarman, striving to arrest his slide, will take on Maxime Janvier of France and N Vijay Sundar Prashanth has been drawn to play Arthur De Greef. — Agencies
